comments.content: With the exception of swashes and some details on /G it looks (a lot) like **[Cheltenham Ultra](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824200436/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Linotype&ffam=ITC%20Cheltenham%20Std%20-%20Ultra&fid=de8e6a0d98546796cd1ff207cb3dd121&fsize=60&text=HIGHS%20AND%20LOWS&fit=1)** but I can't find any Cheltenham variation with swashes... I don't know. Modified?

Cheltenham Ultra with modifications was the best I could come up with as well, although I could swear I've seen this 1970s-inspired look before.

HAL-Highs and Lows is an Australian streetwear brand (est. circa 2005), and there does seem to be a complete alphabet for these characters, based on other visuals/tag lines I found.

Any Australians out there who can enlighten us?
